docs.title: Welcome to Write2Audiobook
docs.text:
Write2Audiobook is a powerful tool that converts EPUB, TXT, PPT, and DOCX documents into engaging audiobooks directly from the command-line. This tool is perfect for making reading more accessible for people with visual impairments and for those who simply prefer listening on the go.

To see Write2Audiobook in action, check out the Quick start guide. Then go to the User guide to learn more.

docs.title: Quick start guide
docs.text: Follow this tutorial to learn how to use Write2Audiobook.

docs.title: Clone the repository
docs.text:
Clone the repository to your computer. Then use the cd command to enter the project's root directory.

git clone https://github.com/deangelisdf/write2audiobook.git
cd write2audiobook

docs.title: Create a virtual environment
docs.text:
To keep your workspace clean and to prevent conflicts with previously installed libraries, create a virtual environment.

python3 -m venv .venv

Activate your virtual environment.

PowershellCommand PromptLinux or macOS 
.venv\Scripts\Activate.ps1

.venv\Scripts\activate.bat

source .venv/bin/activate

docs.title: Install required libraries
docs.text:
Use pip to install the required libraries in your virtual environment.

python3 -m pip install -r requirements

Note

If you're on a Linux system, you must install additional system packages: 

sudo apt update && sudo apt install espeak ffmpeg libespeak1 -y

docs.title: Convert a text-based file to an audiobook
docs.text:
To convert an EPUB file to an audiobook:

python3 ebook2audio.py book.epub

To convert a plain text file to an audiobook:

python3 txt2audio.py text.txt

To convert a PowerPoint presentation (PPTX) to an audiobook:

python3 pptx2audio.py presentation.pptx

To convert a Word document (DOCX) to an audiobook:

python3 docx2audio.py document.docx

docs.title: Play your audiobook
docs.text:
Write2Audio saves your audiobook as an MP3 file in the current directory. It will have the same name as the converted file.

You can listen to your audiobook with any program that can open MP3 files.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
We welcome contributions!

If you'd like to contribute, fork the repository and submit a pull request.

Learn more about contributing to a project through forking.

For major changes, open an issue first to discuss what you would like to change. A major change significantly alters the user interface or the underlying logic of the software.

Feel free to contact us on GitHub if you have any questions, suggestions, or feedback.
